name: Supplies - ICU
remarks: This module includes the supplies needed during daily treatment of COVID-19 in an intensive care setting.  These supplies offer a higher level of protection to the health care provider than the general inpatient setting.
•	PPE strategy = Same as hospitalization, with the exception of gowns.
o	Reusable isolation gowns are approved for extended wear with a max of 2 per patient per 24 hours (i.e. one for day shift nurse and one for night shift nurse)
o	ICU physician maximum room entry per 24 hours is 4
o	ICU nurse maximum room entry per 24 hours is 12
o	Respiratory therapist maximum room entry per 24 hours is 4
o	Allied health/support maximum room entry per 24 hours is 2
| Staff Type                      | Assumed Ratios  | N95 Mask** | Face shield** | Gowns Reusable*** | Gowns single use*** | Wipes*** | Gloves***  | Alcohol*** |

** When calculating total PPE use, these items are not 1:1 with patients, but are determined based on the number of each staff present caring for COVID/PUI patients each 24 hours. (i.e. # staff type X 2)
*** When calculating total PPE use, these items are 1:1 for patients for every 24 hours (i.e. every COVID patient uses 8 gowns, 4 wipes, etc. every 24 hours)
